title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Roswell Waldo to John A. McDonnell, November 20, 1868
summary: Waldo asks for a teacher to be sent to Laurel Hill, a community east of Staunton. He specifically asks for a black teacher, so that he or she will be able to board with a black family, citing white opposition to black schools.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Education, Race Relations, American Civil War
